title: R Workshop - Fall 2023
text:
Thanks for stopping by! This is a website that is designed to hold the files for a workshop that Dustin Haraden is putting together at Rochester Institute of Technology starting in Fall 2023.
The hope is that this will include everything for folks who want to start learning R who are in the social sciences, specifically Psychology.

title: Materials
text:
Here is a word doc that has some topics about what can be covered (link)



Be sure to have the latest versions of R and R-Studio installed. You can do so by navigating to the Posit Website. If you have any trouble, you can take a look at Hands-On Programming with R.

text: Be sure to have the latest versions of R and R-Studio installed. You can do so by navigating to the Posit Website. If you have any trouble, you can take a look at Hands-On Programming with R.

title: Materials
text:
1-Introduction: An Unexpected Journey
During the first session, we plan to go over becoming more comfortable with R and making it your own. Note: When I refer to using R, I am really referring to using R-Studio (the GUI for R). This includes updating some of the default settings in R that will save your environment and all of your data. Having this enabled makes it difficult to practice reproducible coding. Additional steps will include setting up a project, getting familiar with the usage of packages and libraries, and loading in some data.
Once Dustin puts together some slides, they will be linked here:
